alert.note: Alert for Haleakala Summit; Kahoolawe; Kipahulu; Lanai Leeward; Lanai Mauka; Lanai South; Lanai Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Central Valley South; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West; Molokai Leeward South; Molokai North; Molokai Southeast; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; South Haleakala; South Maui, Upcountry; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 1:24AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...Strong showers will impact portions of Kahoolawe, Lanai, Maui and Molokai in Maui County through 300 AM HST... At 123 AM HST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Kepuhi to 6 miles southeast of Keokea. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kahului, Kihei, Lahaina, Lanai City, Hoolehua, Kahakuloa, Haliimaile, Keokea, Makawao, Paia, Wailuku, Kualapuu, Maunaloa, Wailea, Waihee, Kaanapali, Pukalani, Kula, Napili-Honokowai and Kapalua. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
